definition[0]: to defeat someone or stop them from competing against you
example[0]: To see off the threat, the company will have to cut its prices still further.
example[1]: The team saw off their old rivals in last night’s championship game.
definition[1]: to go to an airport, train station etc to say goodbye to someone
example[2]: They’ve gone to the airport to see their son off.
definition[2]: to force someone to leave a place
example[3]: Security guards saw him off the premises.
